title: Sequel To Hrithik-Tiger’s War Might Be On The Cards! Director Says He Has Plans For Franchise
text:
Sequel To Hrithik-Tiger’s War Might Be On The Cards! Director Says He Has Plans For Franchise

Sequel To Hrithik-Tiger’s War Might Be On The Cards! Director Says He Has Plans For Franchise

In just three days, Hrithik Roshan and Tiger Shroff starrer War, an action thriller movie, crossed Rs 100 crores. Beating the record of Salman Khan starrer Bharat, the movie, became the highest opening movie of 2019. After the roaring success of the movie, director Siddharth Anand has hinted that a sequel might be on the cards soon. He even said that he always had plans for a franchise.

Twitter

"It's too early to talk about it, but I definitely had an idea to convert this into a franchise. We were waiting for the audience reaction to the film. Now, I am feeling that it's an audience demand more than our desire. We will soon sit together to decide our future course of action,” he was quoted as saying by IANS.

Instagram

On the first day of its release, Hrithik Roshan and Tiger Shroff starrer War broke eight records. It got the biggest opening in he history of Indian cinema beating Thugs of Hindostan, Tiger Zinda Hai and Bharat. It also became Hrithik Roshan’s biggest opener ever. His last hit was Bang Bang, which collected Rs 27 crores on day one of its release.

War is also the biggest opening movie for Tiger Shroff and also for director Siddharth Anand. Apart from these, the movie now holds record for being the Biggest all-time holiday opening for a Hindi, YRF’s biggest all time opener, biggest original (which is not a sequel or a spin-off) film opener and biggest opener on Gandhi Jayanti.

Indeed, War has set several benchmarks for Hindi films.
